channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Long-Context Autoregressive Video Modeling with Next-Frame Prediction
item.description: Existing RoPE lacks effective temporal decay for remote context and fails to extrapolate well to long video sequences.

item.title: Correcting Deviations from Normality: A Reformulated Diffusion Model for Multi-Class Unsupervised Anomaly Detection
item.description: This leads to potential degradation of normal regions during reconstruction, hampering the effectiveness of anomaly detection.

item.title: Attention IoU: Examining Biases in CelebA using Attention Maps
item.description: Computer vision models have been shown to exhibit and amplify biases across a wide array of datasets and tasks.

item.title: Face Spoofing Detection using Deep Learning
item.description: Spoof detection is critical for enhancing the security of image recognition systems, and this research compares the models effectiveness through accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 score metrics.

item.title: HoGS: Unified Near and Far Object Reconstruction via Homogeneous Gaussian Splatting
item.description: Novel view synthesis has demonstrated impressive progress recently, with 3D Gaussian splatting (3DGS) offering efficient training time and photorealistic real-time rendering.

item.title: CoLLM: A Large Language Model for Composed Image Retrieval
item.description: Experimental results demonstrate that CoLLM achieves state-of-the-art performance across multiple CIR benchmarks and settings.

item.title: RGL: A Graph-Centric, Modular Framework for Efficient Retrieval-Augmented Generation on Graphs
item.description: Recent advances in graph learning have paved the way for innovative retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) systems that leverage the inherent relational structures in graph data.

item.title: Unlocking the Hidden Potential of CLIP in Generalizable Deepfake Detection
item.description: This paper tackles the challenge of detecting partially manipulated facial deepfakes, which involve subtle alterations to specific facial features while retaining the overall context, posing a greater detection difficulty than fully synthetic faces.

item.title: Curriculum Coarse-to-Fine Selection for High-IPC Dataset Distillation
item.description: Recent works on dataset distillation demonstrate that combining distilled and real data can mitigate the effectiveness decay.

item.title: Beyond outlier removal: Integrated ensemble matching for accurate image keypoint correspondence
item.description: This paper presents a novel two-tier matching approach for robust feature correspondence and geometric transformation estimation in computer vision tasks.

item.title: Hardware-Rasterized Ray-Based Gaussian Splatting
item.description: We present a novel, hardware rasterized rendering approach for ray-based 3D Gaussian Splatting (RayGS), obtaining both fast and high-quality results for novel view synthesis.

item.title: LeanStereo: A Leaner Backbone based Stereo Network
item.description: To recover the performance lost because of a leaner backbone, we propose to use learned attention weights based cost volume combined with LogL1 loss for stereo matching.

item.title: Distilling Stereo Networks for Performant and Efficient Leaner Networks
item.description: For instance, our student network while performing better than the performance oriented methods like PSMNet [1], CFNet [2], and LEAStereo [3]) on benchmark SceneFlow dataset, is 8x, 5x, and 8x faster respectively.

item.title: CoMP: Continual Multimodal Pre-training for Vision Foundation Models
item.description: Pre-trained Vision Foundation Models (VFMs) provide strong visual representations for a wide range of applications.

item.title: DINO in the Room: Leveraging 2D Foundation Models for 3D Segmentation
item.description: Vision foundation models (VFMs) trained on large-scale image datasets provide high-quality features that have significantly advanced 2D visual recognition.

item.title: PP-FormulaNet: Bridging Accuracy and Efficiency in Advanced Formula Recognition
item.description: In this work, we present PP-FormulaNet, a state-of-the-art formula recognition model that excels in both accuracy and efficiency.

item.title: GRiNS: A Python Library for Simulating Gene Regulatory Network Dynamics
item.description: The emergent dynamics of complex gene regulatory networks govern various cellular processes.

item.title: MC-LLaVA: Multi-Concept Personalized Vision-Language Model
item.description: To reduce the costs related to joint training, we propose a personalized textual prompt that uses visual token information to initialize concept tokens.

item.title: UniPCGC: Towards Practical Point Cloud Geometry Compression via an Efficient Unified Approach
item.description: Finally, through the dynamic combination of UELC and VRCM, we achieve lossy compression, lossless compression, variable rate and complexity within a unified framework.

item.title: Bootstrapped Model Predictive Control
item.description: In this work, we introduce Bootstrapped Model Predictive Control (BMPC), a novel algorithm that performs policy learning in a bootstrapped manner.

item.title: Equivariant Image Modeling
item.description: Current generative models, such as autoregressive and diffusion approaches, decompose high-dimensional data distribution learning into a series of simpler subtasks.

item.title: xKV: Cross-Layer SVD for KV-Cache Compression
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) with long context windows enable powerful applications but come at the cost of high memory consumption to store the Key and Value states (KV-Cache).

item.title: LinkAlign: Scalable Schema Linking for Real-World Large-Scale Multi-Database Text-to-SQL
item.description: To address this, we introduce LinkAlign, a novel framework that can effectively adapt existing baselines to real-world environments by systematically addressing schema linking.

item.title: SimpleRL-Zoo: Investigating and Taming Zero Reinforcement Learning for Open Base Models in the Wild
item.description: DeepSeek-R1 has shown that long chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning can naturally emerge through a simple reinforcement learning (RL) framework with rule-based rewards, where the training may directly start from the base models-a paradigm referred to as zero RL training.

item.title: Vision-R1: Evolving Human-Free Alignment in Large Vision-Language Models via Vision-Guided Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Large Vision-Language Models (LVLMs) typically follow a two-stage training paradigm-pretraining and supervised fine-tuning.

item.title: Equivariant Machine Learning Interatomic Potentials with Global Charge Redistribution
item.description: Our approach enables more accurate and efficient simulations of systems with long-range interactions and charge heterogeneity, expanding the applicability of MLIPs in computational materials science.

item.title: PathoHR: Breast Cancer Survival Prediction on High-Resolution Pathological Images
item.description: Breast cancer survival prediction in computational pathology presents a remarkable challenge due to tumor heterogeneity.

item.title: SimMotionEdit: Text-Based Human Motion Editing with Motion Similarity Prediction
item.description: Text-based 3D human motion editing is a critical yet challenging task in computer vision and graphics.

item.title: HyperNOs: Automated and Parallel Library for Neural Operators Research
item.description: This paper introduces HyperNOs, a PyTorch library designed to streamline and automate the process of exploring neural operators, with a special focus on hyperparameter optimization for comprehensive and exhaustive exploration.

item.title: PhysTwin: Physics-Informed Reconstruction and Simulation of Deformable Objects from Videos
item.description: Creating a physical digital twin of a real-world object has immense potential in robotics, content creation, and XR.

item.title: ConSol: Sequential Probability Ratio Testing to Find Consistent LLM Reasoning Paths Efficiently
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) integrating explicit reasoning, such as OpenAI's o3-mini, DeepSeek-R1, and QWQ-32B, enable smaller models to solve complex tasks by generating intermediate reasoning steps prior to providing answers.

item.title: Exploring a Principled Framework for Deep Subspace Clustering
item.description: Subspace clustering is a classical unsupervised learning task, built on a basic assumption that high-dimensional data can be approximated by a union of subspaces (UoS).

item.title: Dereflection Any Image with Diffusion Priors and Diversified Data
item.description: Reflection removal of a single image remains a highly challenging task due to the complex entanglement between target scenes and unwanted reflections.

item.title: Structure Is Not Enough: Leveraging Behavior for Neural Network Weight Reconstruction
item.description: This allows such models to be applied to a wide variety of downstream tasks, and they demonstrate strong predictive performance and low reconstruction error.

item.title: Center-guided Classifier for Semantic Segmentation of Remote Sensing Images
item.description: i. e., larger intraclass variance, which makes semantic segmentation for remote sensing images more challenging.

item.title: FastCuRL: Curriculum Reinforcement Learning with Progressive Context Extension for Efficient Training R1-like Reasoning Models
item.description: In this paper, we propose \textbf{\textsc{FastCuRL}}, a simple yet efficient \textbf{Cu}rriculum \textbf{R}einforcement \textbf{L}earning approach with context window extending strategy to accelerate the reinforcement learning training efficiency for R1-like reasoning models while enhancing their performance in tackling complex reasoning tasks with long chain-of-thought rationales, particularly with a 1. 5B parameter language model.

item.title: RAW-Adapter: Adapting Pre-trained Visual Model to Camera RAW Images and A Benchmark
item.description: Despite this, most existing visual perception methods that utilize RAW data directly integrate image signal processing (ISP) stages with subsequent network modules, often overlooking potential synergies at the model level.

item.title: Communities in the Kuramoto Model: Dynamics and Detection via Path Signatures
item.description: Path signatures provide a reparametrization-invariant characterization of dynamical data and, in particular, can be used to compute the lead matrix which reveals lead-lag phenomena.

item.title: FFaceNeRF: Few-shot Face Editing in Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: To utilize masks with a desired layout, an extensive training dataset is required, which is challenging to gather.

item.title: CVE-Bench: A Benchmark for AI Agents' Ability to Exploit Real-World Web Application Vulnerabilities
item.description: Large language model (LLM) agents are increasingly capable of autonomously conducting cyberattacks, posing significant threats to existing applications.

item.title: Enabling Versatile Controls for Video Diffusion Models
item.description: Despite substantial progress in text-to-video generation, achieving precise and flexible control over fine-grained spatiotemporal attributes remains a significant unresolved challenge in video generation research.

item.title: Splat-LOAM: Gaussian Splatting LiDAR Odometry and Mapping
item.description: LiDARs provide accurate geometric measurements, making them valuable for ego-motion estimation and reconstruction tasks.

item.title: Variance Control via Weight Rescaling in LLM Pre-training
item.description: The outcome of Large Language Model (LLM) pre-training strongly depends on weight initialization and variance control strategies.

item.title: Stop Overthinking: A Survey on Efficient Reasoning for Large Language Models
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable capabilities in complex tasks.

item.title: Uni-3DAR: Unified 3D Generation and Understanding via Autoregression on Compressed Spatial Tokens
item.description: The first is a two-level subtree compression strategy, which reduces the octree token sequence by up to 8x.

item.title: Tuning LLMs by RAG Principles: Towards LLM-native Memory
item.description: Memory, additional information beyond the training of large language models (LLMs), is crucial to various real-world applications, such as personal assistant.

item.title: Exploring the Reliability of Self-explanation and its Relationship with Classification in Language Model-driven Financial Analysis
item.description: Language models (LMs) have exhibited exceptional versatility in reasoning and in-depth financial analysis through their proprietary information processing capabilities.

item.title: Deconstructing Long Chain-of-Thought: A Structured Reasoning Optimization Framework for Long CoT Distillation
item.description: Recent advancements in large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable reasoning capabilities through long chain-of-thought (CoT) reasoning.

item.title: Towards Lighter and Robust Evaluation for Retrieval Augmented Generation
item.description: Therefore, we propose a study which demonstrates the interest of open-weight models for evaluating RAG hallucination.

item.title: Unreal-MAP: Unreal-Engine-Based General Platform for Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this paper, we propose Unreal Multi-Agent Playground (Unreal-MAP), an MARL general platform based on the Unreal-Engine (UE).
